message_1: Using second-order logic, find the number of possible subsets of a set with 5 elements. (Hint: The answer should be a numerical value)
message_2:
The number of possible subsets of a set with n elements can be found using the formula 2^n. In this case, n = 5.

2^5 = 32

There are 32 possible subsets of a set with 5 elements.
